intro: Cylindrolobus dilutus, commonly known as the slender sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Its leaves are linear and arranged opposite along the stem, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cylindrolobus dilutus is a low-growing perennial that thrives in arid conditions, making it well adapted to its native environment.
